info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 28 at 12:57PM MST until September 28 at 2:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Big Bug Mesa near Mayer and Dewey-Humboldt.
* WHEN...Until 245 PM MST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Dangerous flooding over low-water crossings. Water flowing over roadways will create slick roads and muddy unpaved roads. Ponding of water on interstates, highways and in urban areas will create hazardous travel conditions.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1256 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Grapevine Creek, Chaparral Gulch, Hackberry Creek, Lynx Creek, Turkey Creek, Milk Creek, Wolf Creek, Pine Creek, Agua Fria River, Big Bug Creek, and Little Wolf Creek.
Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Prescott Valley, Dewey-Humboldt, Mayer, Fain Lake, Mt. Union, Palace Station, Poland Junction and Walker. - This includes State Route 69 between mile markers 271 and 286. - Additional information is available at weather.gov/flagstaff.
info.instruction:
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Low water crossings will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON
